results.title: Enya: Moonshadows
results.creator_credit: M-Oceans Pictures, Warner Music UK and Michael Geoghegan
results.brief_description: This compilation of film clips is a must-see for Enya fans. The film clips add to the dreamy qualities inherent in Enya’s music style. Featuring some of her soundtracks made for film, the compilation includes: Orinoco Flow, Exile, Storm in Africa, Evening Falls, Caribbean Blue.

results.title: Envoyons d' l'avant nos gens. Aupre de ma blonde.
results.creator_credit: Jean-Paul Ladouceur, George Dunning, Cine-Photographie and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Chants populaires”.
Animated interpretation of two french folk songs. ‘Envoyons d’ l’avant nos gens’ 3.47 mins. ‘Aupres de ma blonde’ 5.02 mins.

results.title: Environmental awareness
results.brief_description: This film is a series of finger paintings which demonstrate how the countryside and people are affected by the growth of industry and its consequential pollution. Without words, the film uses music to express mood changes, highlighting environmental situations that emphasise the immediacy of environmental problems today.

results.title: Environment: the British example - a German view = London so long, smog
results.creator_credit: Rudolf Rosthof, NDR TV and Fritz Gebhardt
results.brief_description: In 1952 4,000 people died as a result of “smog”, a mixture of natural fog, soot and smoke, containing poisonous waste gases. The ensuing Clean Air Act designated smokeless zones and all soft coal fires were banned in London. Shows how inspectors keep a close watch on domestic and industrial air pollution, so that smog is a thing of the past.

results.title: Environment in the balance
results.brief_description: Shows how geological, topographical and social developments in Britain have helped to shape its present environment and discusses the problems of industrial expansion, population growth and pollution.

results.title: Environment 1990
results.creator_credit: David H. Fowler, New Zealand National Film Unit and Hugh Macdonald
results.brief_description: Depicts the effects of man upon his environment through mainly visual images. Emphasises the individual’s responsibility in protecting the environment for future generations Credits include: photography by Sam Grau; music by Tony Baker and sound by Kit Rollings

results.title: Entropy: a measure of the disorganization or degradation of the universe (AIE, Module one)
results.creator_credit: Academy of Interactive Entertainment (AIE), Claire Spoelstra, Daniel Riddle, Jason Keen, Kai Faigenbaum and Paul Spence
results.brief_description:
An exercise in exploring the concept of ‘entropy’ by a group of 5 students has resulted in 5 comic, high quality 3D animations.
The works are: Potato feelings (Daniel Riddle), Mad damn cow (Kai Faigenbaum), Letting go (Claire Spoelstra), Train of thought (Jason Keen), Allsorts (Paul Spence)
results.title_for_label: Entropy: a measure of the disorganization or degradation of the universe (AIE, Module one)

results.title: Entropy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Using the experiments used to discuss enthalpy the concept of entropy is developed showing that in any spontaneous change in an isolated system there is an increase in entropy. The film also shows how the National Physical Laboratory determines the entropy of a substance
